doc.field: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 26
Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 26
1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Footage of Andy Humm and Ann Northrop at Breakfast at Gracie Mansion in Honor of Lesbian and Gay Pride Month. Includes footage of Tom Duane, NYC Council Member; Matthew Sperling, Candidate for Congress, 8th District; [unnamed] from the NY Freedom to Marry Committee; Karla, of the Gay and Lesbian Immigration Rights Task Force; and Brian Steel, Candidate for Congress, 8th District.
3. Interview: Doug Sterner, President of the Gay and Lesbian Independent Democrats (GLID), discusses the organization's lack of endorsement in the race for Manhattan Surrogate Court Judge.
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."
4. Footage of Gay and Lesbian Pride Rally at Union Square. Includes footage of Joe Gallagher, International Mr. Leather; Tom Stoddard, [activist]; and The Flirtations, a capella group.
COMMERCIAL: "Support Human Rights for Lesbian and Gay People", sponsored by Professionals in Film/Video. Includes Cathay Che of GLAAD.
5. AIDS News. Includes footage of Lou Maletta interviewing Dr. William Paul, Director of the National Office of AIDS Research.
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, Earth Share, "It's a connected world."
6. Footage of 3rd annual Public Advocate Lesbian and Gay Awards. Includes footage of Mark Green, Public Advocate; Ann Northrop, honoree; and Carol Channing, honoree.
8. Interview: Robert Gomes discusses the film "The Rock". Includes film footage.
9. Lou Maletta interviews Eric Wolf, organizer of the 12 Gods Party, regarding the event.

10. Footage of the Thirteenth Annual Garden Party held by the Lesbian and Gay Community Services Center. Includes footage of the Flirtations, a capella group; Kate Clinton, comedienne; and Jimmy James, [performer].
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."
11. Lou Maletta interviews Lea DeLaria, comedienne, regarding her one-night show at [Caroline's].
12. Lou Maletta urges viewers to pledge money to Gay Cable Network.
